description: This is the JSON Schema of a public crash from Socorro. Its home is github.com/mozilla/socorro

___function.description: If present, the name of the function containing the instruction in this frame.  If missing, either the instruction was not in any known function, or symbols were not available for this module.

___function_offset.description: If present, the offset of the instruction pointer in this frame relative to the function base.

___module_offset.description: If present, the offset of the instruction pointer in this frame relative to the module base.

___line.description: If present, the line in `file` corresponding to the instruction in this frame.

___module.description: If present, the basename of the code module containing the instruction in this frame. If missing, the instruction was not in any known module.

___file.description: If present, the source file containing `function` in this frame. If absent, source line information may not be available for the function. May be a filename or a string including VCS information in the form <vcs>:<repository>:<relative source path>:<changeset>.

___offset.description: The value of the instruction pointer in this frame.

___cpu_info.description: Detailed processor info. Usually contains information such as the family, model, and stepping number.

___java_stack_trace.description: When Java code crashes due to an unhandled exception, this is the Java Stack Trace. It is usually more useful than the system stack trace given for the crashing thread.

___memory_report.description: Anonymized data about the memory usage of the software, generated client-side when a crash report happens because of a memory issue.

___reports.description: A list of reports about various aspects of the memory.

___units.description: The unit of the amount of things.

___process.description: The concerned process, with its pid.

___description.description: A description of what the report is.

___kind.description: Number that tells what kind of report it is.

___path.description: A path to the resource being described.

___app_init_dlls.description: DLLs injected through the AppInit_DLLs registry key.

___proto_signature.description: A concatenation of the signatures of all the frames of the crashing thread.

___hang_type.description:
Tells if a report was caused by a crash or a hang. In the database, the value is `0` if the problem was a crash of the software, and `1` or `-1` if the problem was a hang of the software. 

Note: for querying, you should use `crash` or `hang`, since those are automatically transformed into the correct underlying values.

___accessibility.description: The presence of this field indicates that accessibility services were accessed.

___signature.description: This is the field most commonly used for aggregating individual crash reports into a group. It usually contains one or more stack frames from the crashing thread. The stack frames may also be augmented or replaced with other tokens such as 'OOM | small' or 'shutdownhang' that further identify the crash kind.

___app_notes.description: Notes from the application that crashed. Mostly contains graphics-related annotations.

___flash_version.description: Version of the Flash Player plugin.

___crash_id.description: Unique identifier of the crash report.

___plugin_filename.description: When a plugin process crashes, this is the name of the file of the plugin loaded into that process.

___useragent_locale.description: The locale of the Firefox installation.

___adapter_vendor_id.description: The graphics adapter vendor. This value is sometimes a name, and sometimes a hexidecimal identifier. Common identifiers include: 0x8086 (Intel), 0x1002 (AMD), 0x10de (NVIDIA).

___process_type.description: What type of process the crash happened in. When the main process crashes, this will not be present. But when a plugin or content process crashes, this will be "plugin" or "content".

___minidump_sha256_hash.description: SHA256 hash of the minidump if there was one.

___classification.description: The skunk classification of this crash report, assigned by the processors.
The support classification of this crash report, assigned by the processors.

___reason.description: The crash's exception kind. Different OSes have different exception kinds. Example values: 'EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ', 'EXCEPTION_BREAKPOINT', 'SIGSEGV'.

___dom_ipc_enabled.description: The value of the 'dom.ipc.enabled' preference (in other terms, whether e10s is enabled).

___plugin_version.description: When a plugin process crashes, this is the version of the plugin loaded into that process.

___submitted_from_infobar.description: Whether the crash report was submitted through the infobar.

___graphics_startup_test.description: Whether the crash occured in the DriverCrashGuard.

___memory_measures.description: Memory measurements collected or computed from the memory_report.

___system_heap_allocated.description: The 'system-heap-allocated' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___heap_overhead.description: The 'heap-overhead' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___images.description: The 'images' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___vsize.description: The 'vsize' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___heap_allocated.description: The 'heap-allocated' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___private.description: The 'private' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___heap_unclassified.description: The 'heap-unclassified' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___ghost_windows.description: The 'ghost-windows' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___resident_unique.description: The 'resident-unique' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___host_object_urls.description: The 'host-object-urls' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___vsize_max_contiguous.description: The 'vsize-max-contiguous' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___js_main_runtime.description: The 'js-main-runtime' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___top_none_detached.description: The 'top(none)/detached' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___explicit.description: The 'explicit' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___gfx_textures.description: The 'gfx-textures' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___resident.description: The 'resident' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.

___platform.description: Basic name of the operating system. Can be "Windows NT", "Mac OS X" or "Linux". Use `platform_pretty_version` for a more precise OS name including version.

___build_id.description: The unique build identifier of this version, which is a timestamp of the form YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.

___available_physical_memory.description: The amount of physical memory currently available. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first.

___json_dump.description: The dump as a JSON object.

___tiny_block_size.description: If present, the total size of all memory regions in the crashing process that are smaller than 1 MB.

___status.description: Status of the output of the stackwalker. Can be "OK", "ERROR_*" or "SYMBOL_SUPPLIER_INTERRUPTED".

___symbol_disk_cache_hit.description: Did loading symbols hit disk cacke?

___symbol_url.description: URL of the symbols for that module.

___filename.description: Name of the file of the module.

___base_addr.description: Number of frames in the thread.

___frames.description: Top frames of the crashing thread. Max 10 frames.

___function.description: If present, the name of the function containing the instruction in this frame.  If missing, either the instruction was not in any known function, or symbols were not available for this module.

___function_offset.description: If present, the offset of the instruction pointer in this frame relative to the function base.

___module_offset.description: If present, the offset of the instruction pointer in this frame relative to the module base.

___line.description: If present, the line in `file` corresponding to the instruction in this frame.

___module.description: If present, the basename of the code module containing the instruction in this frame. If missing, the instruction was not in any known module.

___file.description: If present, the source file containing `function` in this frame. If absent, source line information may not be available for the function. May be a filename or a string including VCS information in the form <vcs>:<repository>:<relative source path>:<changeset>.

___offset.description: The value of the instruction pointer in this frame.

___threads_index.description: Index of this thread in the list of threads?

___total_frames.description: Total number of frames in the thread.

___write_combine_size.description: If present, the total size of all committed memory regions in the crashing process marked with PAGE_WRITECOMBINE.

___largest_free_vm_block.description: If present, the size of the largest free block of virtual memory in the crashing process as a hex string.

___function.description: If present, the name of the function containing the instruction in this frame.  If missing, either the instruction was not in any known function, or symbols were not available for this module.

___function_offset.description: If present, the offset of the instruction pointer in this frame relative to the function base.

___module_offset.description: If present, the offset of the instruction pointer in this frame relative to the module base.

___line.description: If present, the line in `file` corresponding to the instruction in this frame.

___module.description: If present, the basename of the code module containing the instruction in this frame. If missing, the instruction was not in any known module.

___file.description: If present, the source file containing `function` in this frame. If absent, source line information may not be available for the function. May be a filename or a string including VCS information in the form <vcs>:<repository>:<relative source path>:<changeset>.

___offset.description: The value of the instruction pointer in this frame.

___frame_count.description: Number of frames in the thread.

___pid.description: Process ID of the crashing process.

___contains_memory_report.description: Has content for processed_crash.memory_report or not.

___startup_crash.description: Annotation that tells whether the crash happened before the startup phase was finished or not.

___user_comments.description: Comments entered by the user when they crashed.

___android_cpu_abi.description: The Android primary CPU ABI being used.

___oom_allocation_size.description: The size of the allocation that caused the OOM crash.

___uptime.description: Length of time the process was running before it crashed. Small values (from 0 to 5 or so) usually indicate start-up crashes.

___total_physical_memory.description: The total amount of physical memory.

___release_channel.description: The update channel that the user is on. Typically "nightly", "aurora", "beta", or "release", but this may also be other values like "release-cck-partner".

___ipc_fatal_error_msg.description: The message linked to an IPC fatal error.

___available_virtual_memory.description: The amount of unreserved and uncommited (i.e. available) memory in the process's address space. Note that this memory may be fragmented into many separate segments, so an allocation attempt may fail even when this value is substantially greater than zero.

___additional_minidumps.description: List the prefixes of the additionnal minidumps, when there are dumps from multiple processes.

___gmp_plugin.description: Whether it is a GMP plugin crash.

___version.description: The product version number. A value lacking any letters indicates a normal release; a value with a 'b' indicates a Beta release; a value with an 'a' indicates an Aurora (a.k.a. Developer Edition) release; a value with 'esr' indicates an Extended Service Release.

___address.description: The crashing address. This value is only meaningful for crashes involving bad memory accesses.

___date.description: Date at which the crash report was received by Socorro.

___total_virtual_memory.description: The size of the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process. This value depends on the type of process, the type of processor, and the configuration of the operating system. 32-bit processes usually have values in the range 2--4 GiB. 64-bit processes usually have *much* larger values.

___install_age.description: Length of time since this version was installed.

___winsock_lsp.description: On Windows, a string of data from the Windows OS about the list of installed LSPs (Layered Service Provider).

___moz_crash_reason.description: For aborts caused by MOZ_CRASH, MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT and related macros, this is the accompanying description.

___topmost_filenames.description: Paths of the files at the top of the stack.

___processor_notes.description: Notes of the Socorro processor, contains information about what changes were made to the report during processing.

___android_cpu_abi2.description: The Android secondary CPU ABI being used.

___platform_pretty_version.description: A better platform name, including version for Windows and Mac OS X.

___safe_mode.description: Whether Firefox was running in Safe Mode.

___addons.description: A list of the addons currently enabled at the time of the crash. This takes the form of "addonid:version,[addonid:version...]". This value could be empty if the crash happens during startup before the addon manager is enabled, and on products/platforms which don't support addons.

___plugin_name.description: When a plugin process crashes, this is the name of the plugin loaded into that process.

___is_garbage_collecting.description: Whether there was a garbage collection in progress.

___cpu_arch.description: The build architecture. Usually one of: 'x86', 'amd64' (a.k.a. x86-64), 'arm', 'arm64'.

___last_crash.description: Length of time between the previous crash submission and this one. Low values indicate repeated crashes.

___ipc_message_name.description: The name of the IPC message.

___android_board.description: The board used by the Android device.

___ipc_fatal_error_protocol.description: The protocol linked to an IPC fatal error.
